div.bibl: History of the Jews of Chicago, Page 50. (Edited by Hyman L. Meites)

body.p: Martin Barbe was born in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1841. He came to Chicago in 1845, and attended the public schools of the city. He also was a member of the first class of the first high school in Chicago.
In January 1851, his was the second Bar Mitzvah performed in Chicago.

Mr. Barbe was in the wholesale clothing business for many years. He was a member of the B'nai B'rith, and at one time had been a member of the executive board of the Sinai Temple. He died on October 29, 1914.
